question.text: In a mouse, duplication of centrioles in cytoplasm is completed in

solution.text: The cell cycle is divided into two phases - Interphase and Mitosis phase or the M phase. The interphase is further divide into 3 phases - Gap 1 or G1 phase, Synthesis phase or S phase and Gap 2 or  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  phase.  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math>  phase is the interval between mitosis and initiation of DNA replication during which the cell is metabolically active and grows but does not replicate. The DNA replication begins in the S phase and the centrioles duplicate in the cytoplasm. In the  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  phase, proteins are synthesised in preparation for mitosis while cell growth continues.
